bib.title: Complete and incomplete fusion of Li-6 ions with Bi and Pt.

free_txt: Bi + 6Li
Pt + 6Li reaction
Pt + 6Li reaction
Trasl. of FCY/L,6,342,2009
the U400 heavy-ion cyclotron of FLNR,
JINR, Dubna
SB
.New reference was added.
SD: DATA blocks were replaced by author's
data in Subents 5 and 6. Cosmetic changes in Sub. 2-12.
SD: Ref. on JP/CS,420 was added
SD: Ref. FCY/L,6,342 was added.
.Statistical model using the ALICE-MP code.
*By authors*.The products of complete and incomplete
fusion from the interaction of Li-6 with Bi-209 are
mostly alpha-radioactive. The products of the platinum
targets are gamma-radioactive. The used target
thicknesses are optimal for investigating products of
relatively low yields and for the registration of the
alpha-activity with satisfactory energy resolution.
MSP-144 magnetic spectrometer for measuring
energy and as an energy monochromatizer.
the U400 heavy-ion cyclotron of FLNR,
JINR, Dubna
Stacked-foil activation technique.
.Table data were received from Dr.A.A.Kulko
Entry was approved by authors.
A semiconductor detector measuring
alpha activity.
.The errors is reported by authors.
.The errors is reported by authors.
The Bi targets were about 700 mug/cm**2 thick and were
produced by evaporation in vacuum of natural Bi on
a 5 mum thick aluminum foil.The target thickness was
enough to completely stop the heavy reaction products.
.Data corresponds to fig. 3 of JP/G,36,025104
*By authors*.The yields necessary for calculating the
production cross sections of Rn-211 and At-211 were
determined using the difference in their half-lives in
the decomposition of the experimental decay curves.
It was found that the formation of At-211 as the
daughter of Rn-211 is more preferable than through the
alpha-transfer from Li-6 channel.
A semiconductor detector measuring alpha activity.

*By authors*.The alpha-spectra, from which the yield of
Po-208 was determined, were measured after more than
two  half-life periods of Po-210, whose contribution to
the spectra was then considerably lowered.
A semiconductor detector measuring alpha activity.

Data received from Dr. V.Maslov
*By authors*.The counting rate due to Po-210 was
measured a few times during several months following
the irradiation. In this case, the contribution of
Po-208 could be neglected because of its long half-life
of 2.9 years.
A semiconductor detector measuring alpha activity.
.The errors is reported by authors.
by authors.

Data received from Dr. V.Maslov
.For the analysis of the gamma-spectra the
programme DEIMOS32 was used.
*By authors*.The experimental cross sections of the Tl
isotopes, formed after the evaporation from the
compound Tl isotopes of three to five neutrons, were
calculated on the basis of the measured yields
accounting for the relevant beam dose and time factors,
the efficiency of the detectors, the absolute intensity
of the gamma-transitions and the target thickness.
After the irradiation, the gamma-activity
induced in the individual gold foils was measured
off-line using four energy and efficiency-calibrated
HPGe detectors (the efficiency was about 4-5% for
E(g)= 662 keV) of high-energy resolution (1.2 keV for
the gamma-transition at 1332 keV.
.The errors is reported by authors.
by authors.
.The errors is reported by authors.
The induced gamma-ray activity in the Al degraders
used in the Pt stack served also to monitor the beam
dose via the cross section for production of Na-24.
The targets were of natural platinum. The main
contribution is expected to come from the isotopes-
For this reason,the calculations of the cross sections
of the different channels had to be done accounting for
the contribution of the different Pt isotopes according
to their presence in natural platinum.
.Data corresponds to fig. 5 of JP/G,36,025104
.For the analysis of the gamma-spectra the
programme DEIMOS32 was used.
